common

Class Compare

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.Compare

  • public class Compare
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implement different Word comparing method You can work with this class only via singelton access: Compare compare = Compare.getSingelton();
    See Also:
    Word

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double distanceBetweenWords(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2)
      Calculating distance between word1 and word2 using recursive and symbol distance distanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == (recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) + symbolDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2)) / 2;
      double distanceBetweenWords(Word word1, Word word2)
      Calculating distance between word1 and word2 using recursive and symbol distance distanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == (recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) + symbolDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2)) / 2;
      static Compare getSingelton()
      For getting Compare object just call this method EXAMPLE: Compare compare = Compare.getSingelton();
      java.lang.String longestSubstring(java.lang.String str1, java.lang.String str2)
      this method return longest common substring in str1 and str2 it is case sensative EXAMPLE: String str1 = new String("aabbcc"); String str2 = new String("eebbdd"); new Compare.longestSubstring(str1, str2); // will return "bb"; NOTE: if str1 or str2 is null will return empty String; this method was copy/pasted from http://karussell.wordpress.com/2011/04/14/longest-common-substring-algorithm-in-java/ SEE:
      java.lang.String longestSubstring(Word word1, Word word2)
      this method return longest common substring in word1 and word2 it is case sensative EXAMPLE: Word word1 = new Word("aabbcc"); Word word2 = new Word("eebbdd"); new Compare.longestSubstring(word1, word2); // will return "bb"; NOTE: if word1 or word2 is null will return empty String; this method was copy/pasted from http://karussell.wordpress.com/2011/04/14/longest-common-substring-algorithm-in-java/ SEE:
      double recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2)
      method calculating recursive distance between words word1 and word2 returning value [0, 1]: from 0 to 1 when 0 - word1 not equal word2 at all 1 - word1 same as word2 if recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == 1 then word1.equal(word2) == true SEE:
      double recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(Word word1, Word word2)
      method calculating recursive distance between words word1 and word2 returning value [0, 1]: from 0 to 1 when 0 - word1 not equal word2 at all 1 - word1 same as word2 if recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == 1 then word1.equal(word2) == true SEE:
      double symbolDistanceBetweenWords(java.lang.String word1, java.lang.String word2)
      method calculating symbol distance between words word1 and word2 returning value [0, 1]: from 0 to 1 when 0 - word1 not equal word2 at all 1 - word1 same as word2 if recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == 1 then word1.equal(word2) == true SEE:
      double symbolDistanceBetweenWords(Word word1, Word word2)
      method calculating symbol distance between words word1 and word2 returning value [0, 1]: from 0 to 1 when 0 - word1 not equal word2 at all 1 - word1 same as word2 if recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == 1 then word1.equal(word2) == true SEE:

      • symbolDistanceBetweenWords

        public double symbolDistanceBetweenWords(Word word1,
                                Word word2)
        method calculating symbol distance between words word1 and word2 returning value [0, 1]: from 0 to 1 when 0 - word1 not equal word2 at all 1 - word1 same as word2 if recursiveDistanceBetweenWords(word1, word2) == 1 then word1.equal(word2) == true SEE:

        word2 -

      • longestSubstring

        public java.lang.String longestSubstring(Word word1,
                                Word word2)
        this method return longest common substring in word1 and word2 it is case sensative EXAMPLE: Word word1 = new Word("aabbcc"); Word word2 = new Word("eebbdd"); new Compare.longestSubstring(word1, word2); // will return "bb"; NOTE: if word1 or word2 is null will return empty String; this method was copy/pasted from http://karussell.wordpress.com/2011/04/14/longest-common-substring-algorithm-in-java/ SEE:
        Parameters:
        word1 -
        word2 -
        Returns:
        String (longest common substring in words)
        See Also:
